sentences.english: Studies of adults show what's known as a baby-face bias.
sentences.chinese: 研究成年人知道什麼事娃娃臉偏見。

sentences.english: The old man with a baby-face looks very young.
sentences.chinese: 那個長着一張娃娃臉的老人看起來很年輕。

sentences.english: One way Bieber adds a little character and maturity to his baby face?
sentences.chinese: 比寶要如何給自己的娃娃臉添上點個性和成熟氣質呢？

sentences.english: Black CEOs were rated as being more babyfaced, and having warmer personalities, than whites.
sentences.chinese: 黑人CEO被評爲與白人相比更具娃娃臉，更熱情。

sentences.english: Babyface features had a clear influence on professional achievement, both perceived and real.
sentences.chinese: 娃娃臉特徵對幻想和現實的專業成就有明確的影響。

definition: to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3

definition: (of fruit etc) fresh/(of a person etc) full of life/healthy-looking/(of eyes) moist and bright/lustrous
